**COURSE DESCRIPTION**

This course aims to prepare students to use English in business settings and to discuss selective business-related topics. Relevant terminologies and patterns will be introduced and practiced in each class meeting. Students are expected to use four skills to participate in a variety of in-class activities, including the discussion and role-play. In the end of this course, students will be asked to work on a group proposal with clear and persuasive language.

**Presentation**: **I want to run a \_\_\_\_\_\_ shop/business!** **(4 people in one group)**

Description: Imagine that you want to start your own business. A lot of decisions have to be made, with a lot of investigation and research. You have to do research and decide, for example,:

1.  what you want to sell or run,
2.  whether the shop is online, physical, or both,
3.  how many staff members you need, how you are going to recruit more workers, what will be prioritized in your employment notices
4.  what aspect do your individual group members work on,
5.  how are you going to design the menu and the price

The list could go on and on.

Midterm Progress Report

A midterm progress presentation will cover essential elements of starting a business. More details will be announced.

Final Proposal Report

Final Presentation will be in a form of trade fair. You have to promote your ideas to your classmates and answer their questions.

**Reviews****: Individual or pair, audio/video**

You are expected to do some research on the shop/business you want to run.

1.  pick a reference (a book, a news clip, a video, or a commercial)
2.  introduce and summarize your reference to your classmates
3.  note three useful expressions you learn from the references
4.  upload your audio/video to MOODLE

1.  Each student needs to watch/listen to 2 videos and leave comments.
